title: The King of Glory
shortSummary: Psalm 24 declares God's sovereign ownership over the earth and challenges believers to approach Him with purity and righteousness. It culminates in a triumphant call for the gates to open for the King of glory, emphasizing God's might and holiness. This psalm beautifully combines themes of creation, holiness, and worship.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of the psalm, King David, who expresses worship and reverence for God's sovereignty and holiness.

keyCharacters.name: Jacob
keyCharacters.description: Representative of the people of Israel, called to seek God’s face and live righteously.

definitions.definition: A Hebrew term found in the Psalms, likely indicating a pause for contemplation or musical interlude.
A title for God emphasizing His majestic power, divine sovereignty, and victorious strength.
A metaphor for moral purity and innocence in actions.
A condition of inner sincerity and holiness, free from deceit or evil intentions.

outline.heading: God’s Sovereignty Over Creation
outline.description: The psalm opens by affirming that the entire earth and all who live in it belong to the LORD, who established the world upon the seas and floods, highlighting His creative power and authority.

outline.heading: The Requirements to Approach God
outline.description: David poses the question of who is worthy to stand in God's holy presence, answering that only those with clean hands, pure hearts, and sincere devotion will receive God's blessing and righteousness.

outline.heading: The Triumphal Entry of the King of Glory
outline.description: A call for the gates to lift up their heads for the King of glory to enter, identifying Him as the LORD strong and mighty, the LORD mighty in battle, and the LORD of hosts, emphasizing His victorious and majestic nature.

application: Approach God with moral purity and sincerity, examining your heart and actions regularly to ensure they align with His holiness.
Seek God earnestly and persistently, knowing that those who seek His face will receive His blessings and righteousness.
Recognize and worship God as the sovereign King of glory, trusting in His power and victory over all challenges.
Open your life like the gates in the psalm, allowing Christ, the King of glory, to enter and reign fully.

keyVerses.text: The earth is the LORD'S, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.
keyVerses.significance: This verse establishes God's absolute ownership and authority over all creation.

keyVerses.text: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.
keyVerses.significance: It defines the moral and spiritual qualifications necessary to stand in God's holy presence.

keyVerses.text: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.
keyVerses.significance: This triumphant call invites the entrance of the victorious and majestic King of glory.

keyVerses.text: Who is this King of glory? The LORD of hosts, he is the King of glory. Selah.
keyVerses.significance: It confirms the identity of the King of glory as the LORD of hosts, emphasizing His divine power and majesty.
